programme.title: Bargain Mansions
programme.desc: After a contractor abandons an 1890s Craftsman-style home, Tamara Day steps in to finish its renovation; she repairs structural damage and tears down a load-bearing wall to enlarge the kitchen; an exterior iron staircase presents problems.

programme.title: Bargain Mansions

programme.title: Bargain Mansions

programme.title: Bargain Mansions

programme.title: Jade Fever
programme.desc: In Jade City, British Columbia, the Bunce family has for decades taken advantage of the region's rich jade deposits to mine for the precious stone in Northern B.C.'s Cassiar Mountains. This reality series follows the Bunce's operation, which employs most of the town's residents, and their efforts to turn various claims into elusive million-dollar jackpots. In addition to highlighting dangerous mining adventures, storylines include how "The Boss," Claudia Bunce, and her mine manager husband Robin secure investors and keep them happy, plus interplay between employees including Bunce brothers Joshua and Justin.

programme.desc: Cities may seem unlikely havens for wildlife, but for animals able to adapt, the urban world is filled with opportunity. This first episode examines what it takes for wild animals to thrive in the fastest changing habitat on the planet.

programme.title: Ben Fogle: Return to the Wild
programme.desc: Ben Fogle reunites with a man with a gift for craftsmanship living in the swamplands of Georgia. Ben discovers he has experienced a life-changing accident in the six years since they last met, but remains as competitive as he was on their original encounter.

programme.title: One Cup: A Thousand Stories
programme.desc: Starting in the busy container port and tea centre of Dubai, a tea hub where millions of tonnes of tea are traded from east to west, we move in Fujian Province to witness the beautiful natural withering process of White Tea, increasing in popularity in China and around the world.

programme.title: Dawn To Dusk
programme.desc: See how creatures from the Tibetan plateau, to the lush rainforests of Thailand, to Vietnam's twisted mangroves, survive four extra hours of daylight once a year, searching for food, fighting for dominance, and raising their families.

programme.title: Dawn To Dusk
programme.desc: Find out which creatures survive and whose luck will run out as animal mothers and moms-to-be struggle with sweltering temperatures, lurking predators, mating season, and drought on a day that proves to be no holiday.

programme.title: Dogs With Extraordinary Jobs
programme.desc: Meet a golden retriever that assuages anxiety and helps heal PTSD, a shepherd mix who rescues mudslide survivors, a pair of spaniels who sniff out underground water leaks, and a group of teacher's pets in the UK that assist children learning to read.

programme.title: Dogs With Extraordinary Jobs
programme.desc: A blind woman has found a new lease on life thanks to her canine running mate, a Jack Russell works as a super-nanny to a surprising array of species, and a team of dogs in Kenya are on daily patrol protecting endangered rhinos from poachers.

programme.title: Dawn To Dusk

programme.title: Baboons: Rules Of The Troop
programme.desc: Follow four different baboon families-a resourceful beach troop, the warlike desert troop, the disciplined river troop, and the peaceful mountain band-to find out why these primates are among the most successful animals in Africa.

programme.title: Alaskan Summer
programme.desc: Discover the majesty of the US's most northern state. Shot in stunning HDR, travel from the breathtaking coves and bays of Baranof Island, to the Glacier Bay where humpback and killer whales navigate among towering glaciers and soaring mountains.

programme.title: Mysteries of Evolution
programme.desc: Why do zebras have stripes? How do penguins see underwater? And why are a tree frog's eyes red? In this exploration of sight, discover how some animals have evolved to see extremely well while others have evolved to be nearly invisible.

programme.title: Great Parks of Africa
programme.desc: Discover a patchwork of thriving habitats in Garden Route National Park, from dense forest canopies that hide elusive birds to tropical breeding grounds filled with humpback whales.

programme.title: The Living Beach
programme.desc: The drought is driving Mule Deer out of their habitats. The warming ocean is sending Sea Lions in another direction. The Pelicans are trying to survive coastal oil spills. What will become of the beautiful beaches of California?

programme.title: Mysteries of Evolution

programme.desc: See how creatures from the Tibetan plateau, to the lush rainforests of Thailand, to Vietnam's twisted mangroves, survive four extra hours of daylight once a year, searching for food, fighting for dominance, and raising their families.

programme.title: Dawn To Dusk
programme.desc: Find out which creatures survive and whose luck will run out as animal mothers and moms-to-be struggle with sweltering temperatures, lurking predators, mating season, and drought on a day that proves to be no holiday.

programme.title: Baboons: Rules Of The Troop
programme.desc: Follow four different baboon families-a resourceful beach troop, the warlike desert troop, the disciplined river troop, and the peaceful mountain band-to find out why these primates are among the most successful animals in Africa.

programme.title: Alaskan Summer
programme.desc: Discover the majesty of the US's most northern state. Shot in stunning HDR, travel from the breathtaking coves and bays of Baranof Island, to the Glacier Bay where humpback and killer whales navigate among towering glaciers and soaring mountains.

programme.title: Mysteries of Evolution
programme.desc: Some call them "living fossils," but that's just another way to say survivors. From the shark to the horseshoe crab, these animals' early adaptations were a success, leaving them relatively unchanged for millions of years.

programme.title: Baby Animals
programme.desc: Elephants, gorillas, rhinos, and bison are among the largest and most imposing land-dwelling mammals, but they all start out as helpless infants. See how babies from each species find their way to becoming giants.

programme.title: Brazil Untamed
programme.desc: Explore the southern edge of the Pantanal, where brown capuchin monkeys live in their own Garden of Eden. Dry season in the highlands treats them well until a drought dries up their food sources. Can an industrious agouti save them from starvation?

programme.title: Brazil Untamed
programme.desc: Witness the arrival of more than 650 bird species to the marshes and treetops of the Pantanal. Breeding season is accompanied by feasts for jabiru storks, cozy nest-making for hyacinth macaws, and mealtime squabbles for turkey vultures.

programme.title: Wild Rockies
programme.desc: Herds of elk and moose live side-by side with predators such as bears and wolves in the Rockies. See elk and osprey try to find food in the Kootenay area, and discover why removing wolves from an ecosystem can have huge repercussions.

programme.title: In For The Kill
programme.desc: Marvel at the clever ways predators use cunning, agility, and breakneck speed when taking down prey. Witness luring behaviours and see how some killers hide in plain sight, while others put weaponry or chemical warfare to work to bring dinner home.

programme.title: Gangs Of Lemur Island
programme.desc: As the babies grow, new power struggles break out in each troop. Watch as every member, from fierce Queen Crystal to low-ranking Erica, jockeys for position. Meanwhile, the babies start to understand how allies and enemies will shape their future.

programme.title: Gangs Of Lemur Island
programme.desc: The pressure to find food reaches new heights and throws the reserve into turmoil. Witness fractures emerge within the ranks, dividing the gangs and leading Crystal, the indomitable leader of the Ruins gang, to face a challenge like none before.

programme.title: Land of Gremlins
programme.desc: Follow a family of indris, some of the world's largest lemurs, on their daily quest through the rainforest to find food and escape predators. See how these endangered primates survive against all odds in a rapidly shrinking habitat.

programme.title: Land of Gremlins
programme.desc: Tour Madagascar's tall mountain ranges, lush rainforests, treed coastal plains, and parched deserts. See how Jurassic-era plants, ancient frog and reptile species, and new castaways have evolved in these strange, beautiful landscapes.

programme.title: Dawn To Dusk
programme.desc: Live through a sunny tropical September day with creatures from Polynesia to the Indonesian archipelago. See how the sun affects the movement, feeding habits, and mating rituals of everything from tiny zooplankton to whale sharks.

programme.title: Dawn To Dusk
programme.desc: Celebrate the first day of spring with Aussie creatures looking for either a dinner or a date. From the kangaroos in the grasslands to the koalas in the trees to the freshwater crocodiles, they hunt for food or fight for breeding rights.

programme.title: Africa's Wild Horizons
programme.desc: Experience the life-giving force of a lush and beautiful delta. Go deep into the arid expanse of the Kalahari Desert to see land shaped by the unstoppable flow of inland floods, creating one of the greatest wildlife havens in Africa.

programme.title: Gangs Of Lemur Island
programme.desc: The pressure to find food reaches new heights and throws the reserve into turmoil. Witness fractures emerge within the ranks, dividing the gangs and leading Crystal, the indomitable leader of the Ruins gang, to face a challenge like none before.

programme.title: Wild Rockies
programme.desc: The peaks of the Rocky Mountains are among the highest and harshest on the continent: the air is thin and cold, the terrain is steep, and the trees can't root. Learn how mountain goats, bighorn sheep, and black bears defy these harsh conditions.

programme.title: Baby Animals
programme.desc: Elephants, gorillas, rhinos, and bison are among the largest and most imposing land-dwelling mammals, but they all start out as helpless infants. See how babies from each species find their way to becoming giants.

programme.title: Dawn To Dusk
programme.desc: Live through a sunny tropical September day with creatures from Polynesia to the Indonesian archipelago. See how the sun affects the movement, feeding habits, and mating rituals of everything from tiny zooplankton to whale sharks.

programme.title: Dawn To Dusk
programme.desc: Celebrate the first day of spring with Aussie creatures looking for either a dinner or a date. From the kangaroos in the grasslands to the koalas in the trees to the freshwater crocodiles, they hunt for food or fight for breeding rights.

programme.title: Baby Animals
programme.desc: Not all infants in the animal kingdom get to have a good mother. But these are the stories of the lucky ones, from a ring-tailed lemur who learns everything from its mom to a tiny orangutan that receives a constant supply of motherly cuddles.

programme.title: Baby Animals
programme.desc: Watch fur seals give birth by the thousands, black bear cubs wrestle with their buddies, and meerkat pups forge bonds by sharing chores-all proving that growing up in the animal kingdom is easier when you have numbers on your side.

programme.title: Brazil Untamed
programme.desc: Trek through the forests and savannahs of the Pantanal's Nhecolandia region, which is home to noisy herds of peccaries. Follow these pig-like mammals on their daily food-foraging routes, and run into roseate spoonbills and capybaras along the way.

programme.title: Brazil Untamed
programme.desc: Track a young jaguar as he practises hunting the way his mother taught him to. Watch him take on a caiman, who tests the inexperienced cat's skills with quick moves and surprising power. Then follow the jaguar mother on her prowl for a new mate.

programme.title: Wild Rockies
programme.desc: The lakes, rivers, and marshes that pulse through the Rockies sustain an awesome diversity of life. From the inhospitable peaks to teeming ocean deltas, discover how water is the key to keeping all aspects of mountain life thriving.

programme.title: Orangutan Jungle School
programme.desc: Witness some big changes when four cute new arrivals join the nursery classes. And for a handful of adolescent males that are growing too big and boisterous for their babysitters, it's their last day at forest school.

programme.title: Orangutan Jungle School
programme.desc: Crash a fruit-flinging party celebrating the return of Jelapat, Talaken, Bawan, and Rona to the nursery to join the rest of their classmates. Meanwhile, flooding overtakes the pre-release islands, and injuries stifle the progress of two students.

programme.title: Orangutan Jungle School
programme.desc: Watch a milestone moment when two students get their first forest time in years. And another pair of students are confined to the school's clinic after an accident in the forest leaves Beni with a broken leg and Lala with a broken elbow.

programme.title: Orangutan Jungle School
programme.desc: Beni and Lala are going stir crazy in the sick bay, but they must recover before returning to the rough and tumble of class. And at forest school, a termite-foraging lesson inspires class clown Valentino to make a finger-licking discovery.

programme.title: Orangutan Jungle School
programme.desc: Join two seriously ill orangutans in the medical clinic, where Erik's head infection is causing concern and fourteen-year-old Mia's life depends on a blood transfusion. Outside the clinic, the infants find a secret treat hidden inside a rubber tree.

programme.title: Dawn To Dusk
programme.desc: Meet the unique primates and reptiles searching for water and dodging predators, from ring-tailed lemurs in the east coast rainforests to tiny brown leaf chameleons, in this land of extreme climate variations and habitats.

programme.title: Dawn To Dusk
programme.desc: Visit one of the most arid and hottest parts of the world to discover how dhub lizards and dromedary camels adapted to withstand the intense conditions. Then move into the more moderate southern mountains, where rare hyrax and chameleons forage.

programme.title: Wild Rockies
programme.desc: The mix of old and new growth forests in the Rockies creates a balance that allows each species to thrive. Learn how both Mother Nature and humans are protecting this essential mix of forests, even if that means destroying them once in a while.

programme.title: Baby Animals
programme.desc: Infancy isn't all fun and games. Some animals must hit the ground running to avoid becoming dinner for predators. Take an in-depth look at what life is like for newborn animals that must learn fast your die young.

programme.title: Baby Animals
programme.desc: Life at the upper end of the food chain means hard work and constant learning. Discover how young predators, from lion and cheetah cubs to coyotes and silver fox kits, learn to move stealthily and harness their highly adapted skills.

programme.title: Great Parks of Africa
programme.desc: See how a single river sustains all life in the northern reaches of Kruger National Park, especially in the height of the dry season.

programme.title: Undiscovered Vistas
programme.desc: The alien terrain of Gros Morne is the result of an earth-shattering collision of continents nearly 500 million years ago. Take a rare view of one of the world's geographic wonders through soaring aerial shots of glacier-carved fjords and cliffs.

programme.title: Stem Cell Universe With Stephen Hawking
programme.desc: Led by Stephen Hawking, this special delves into the subject of stem cells to explore what these mechanisms are capable of.

programme.title: How The Universe Works (S8)
programme.desc: We thought our moon was a dead rock in space, but new research suggests we were wrong.

programme.title: Through The Wormhole With Morgan Freeman (S4)
programme.desc: What if everything that has or will happen in the universe has already been determined and we are unable to change our inevitable destinies?

programme.desc: A revolutionary helicopter helps prevent avalanches at the Winter Olympics.

programme.title: Blowing Up History (S5)
programme.desc: The Valley of the Queens is a vast necropolis concealing some of Egypt's most miraculous tombs and powerful women.

programme.title: Super Systems (S2)
programme.desc: Ships as big as the Empire State Building arrive daily at the Port of Los Angeles, where teams of longshoremen unload millions of containers onto trucks and trains.

programme.desc: Find out how stainless steel, football helmets, resin figurines and laboratory glassware are made.
